intro: Euphrasia kashmiriana, commonly known as Kashmir eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are clustered in dense racemes. Euphrasia kashmiriana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
